reviews.text:
Omg, so, bad..

I visited once about 1.5 years ago, loved it, visit back, man, somebody tell me what happened during the past 1.5 years:

Service was pretty good overall, they had this Halloween theme going on, passionate about the dishes and all that,

except several times they forgot their lines (could be too much party the previous night, understandable.) also no one greeted us when we leave, very strange, we just walked out of the place like that.

Let me start with the beverage pairing, it was a disaster. We got served with a cheap Japanese whisky, oaky and a bit smokey during seafood course, and there was no white wine across the whole menu.. first drink was a full glass of dry martini.. second drink natural wine was so natural it tasted like what wine makers use in biodynamic methods (ifkyk).

Not a big fan of the seasonal menu this time, but this is depending on your taste. they served tuna bone twice once sashimi once cooked. They served sesame course twice, one was with caviar. Problem is the sesame wasn‚Äôt very fresh so the smell covers the whole dish you couldn‚Äôt taste others. There was a dish where you grind veggies together to make a paste, then spread over sour dough, creative. Our server did it right by grinding it over his palm, I did see other servers grind it on customer‚Äôs table and making big noise, common sense.

Ambient was amazing which I like. Total 1k + for 2 pax without tips.
This was such a fun dinner, the staff is so chill and just having a good time. The field guide was amazing and i genuinely left with a smile. Get the carajillo at the end or you‚Äôve missed a treat

I‚Äôve been wanting to try Ilis for a long time. I live across the street and walk by it every day, always admiring its interior‚Äîwithout question one of the most beautiful restaurant spaces I‚Äôve ever seen. The lighting, materials, and atmosphere are stunning. Unfortunately, the experience didn‚Äôt live up to the setting.

I went with a couple of friends just planning to have a cocktail, but we ended up ordering a few small plates to share. I explained clearly to the bartender that I prefer dry, non-sweet drinks and gave specific examples, yet the cocktail I was recommended‚Äîthough decent‚Äîwas far too sweet and completely missed the mark. When I mentioned this, the bartender‚Äôs reaction was dismissive and slightly aggressive, which made the interaction uncomfortable and took away from the experience.

We ordered the sourdough with butter and nightshades, which looked promising. The nightshades were flavorful, but the butter had a slightly rancid, sour taste that lingered unpleasantly. The bread itself was fine but plain, and the portioning was frustrating‚Äîonly one slice cut in half, which wasn‚Äôt nearly enough to pair with the generous amount of butter and toppings. Even after asking for more bread, it still felt unbalanced.

The whelk dish was by far the most disappointing. I‚Äôve had whelk before and enjoyed it elsewhere, but here it was overwhelmingly strong and left a harsh, savory taste that lingered long after eating. It completely overpowered everything else, including my drink, and it didn‚Äôt sit well with me physically‚ÄîI ended up with an upset stomach and felt slightly sick afterward.

I wanted to love Ilis. The space is beautiful, the concept ambitious, and it clearly has a following. But between the overly sweet cocktail, unbalanced small plates, and the unpleasant whelk, the experience fell short. Ilis has all the potential to be extraordinary, but my visit left me disappointed and in no rush to return.

Came here on 10/17/25, service was amazing, dishes were to die for and drinks were amazing. Everything is so good and I definitely recommend coming here. If you come here please try the meringue angel foodcake, trout and cotton candy drink. FYI: THE WHOLE COURSE TAKES 2 TO 3 HOURS SO BE READY TO WAIT. In general though this restaurant is amazing! üî•üëåüî•

Finally satisfied a longing I‚Äôve had to visit and dine with Ilis. Each day time someone dines with a restaurant is an opportunity to make their day. I‚Äôd say Ilis has done so for my entire gastronomical fall season

To quote the Michelin guide: The brainchild of Noma-alum (and co-founder) Mads Refslund and his business partner Will Douillet, Ilis seeks to elevate the dining experience through every touchpoint.

It has succeeded. In fact, I‚Äôd say beyond elevation and has shot for and reached the moon.

I‚Äôve dreamed of visiting Noma, and so upon reading about Ilis‚Äô opening, my curiosity was piqued. The experience is both dazzling and comforting. At times one can feel, as someone once put, little when experiencing fine dining. I brought my niece for late  birthday celebrations, and I noted her wonder, surprise, but also ease in being there.

The dining experience was a like a symphony with rich segments, harmonies, and crescendos. When is the last time you found yourself unable to describe flavors of a dish? Or so compelled to simply sit in silence allowing all presence to go towards your taste buds. These are desperate attempts to put in words an indescribable feeling, brought to you by Ilis ü§ç

Thank you to Breanna (forgive a potential misspelling), our gracious server; Ian, the exquisite sommelier with whom I shared a delicately profound reflection over a glass of cabernet franc; and of course Mads for the wonderful surprising creationsüôèüèæüôèüèæüôèüèæ

Still sitting at the restaurant while writing this out of boredom. We sat down at 5:30 and now it is almost 9, we still have 1/3 of the dish not served yet.

Food is not good tasting. I feel like they just don‚Äôt know how to cook food to make them delicious, more like experimenting new ways to cook just for the sake of it. It is either too sour, or too raw, or too plain.

Serving speed is really slow. Prepare for a night of sitting around and waiting - they have severs and cooks rotate and serve so everybody is doing something they are not good at at some points of the night. Maybe that‚Äôs why.

Very expensive, too. We had the filed guide, pretty steep price even for find dining. But the worst taste and one of the worse services I have had. And I am usually accompanying my wife at these fine dining places so I had very little complains usually. But I felt strongly to write this (also bored just waiting). My wife passed on more than half of the dishes because she just couldn‚Äôt justify eating them after having a taste. And she is more than happy to eat the food I cook at home, and I am just a freaking regular guy.

Very not recommended. Save yourself the time and money and don‚Äôt bother coming.

Oh just before I am going to submit this review, they actually brought our bill- and we still have 3 dishes left!!!! What a joke

The food and experience was exquisite all around! There is nothing as innovative and full of artistry in NYC as what is happening at Ilis. I loved how each dish is accompanied by elements of the habitat from which it came.

This restaurant is incredible, the best restaurant that I currently know in NYC. One thing I suggest to watch out for is the reservation. If you go through their email contact you might talk to Pia. Pia, will upsell you optional menus as‚Ä¶

Extraordinarily special and unique dining & drink experience within a very large open slab on grade one story warehouse that exudes a memorable energy that I have not experienced anywhere else in New York!

This setting alone makes it one of a kind and the awesome food, drink & friendly caring staff culminates into me asking when can we go back... for at least just a cocktail. Celebrated my engagement in the lounge area and ran through some super highly recommended wines, great cocktails and lots of seafood. They know what's good.
Magic and one of the best meals of my life. Thank you Chef!

Beautiful restaurant. Unfortunately the space was the best part. Food was good but nothing noteworthy. The portions were also quite small and I left still feeling hungry. Service was also a bit off. All in all didn‚Äôt live up to the hype
The best. -Eatingtools

It‚Äôs been a few months since I ate at Ilis and I unfortunately won‚Äôt be returning or recommending. In fact, I often find myself telling others that it was one of my most disappointing tasting menu experiences. I was expecting great things given the restaurants legacy, and from the many positive reviews from NYT to The Infatuation. BLUF - when your atmosphere, fine dining service take the focus away from or are at the expense of the taste of the dishes, you‚Äôve gone astray. Great service, great atmosphere, but truly a 2/5 on taste.
We went here for my partner's birthday. It was an excellent experience.
Everything was fantastic. Can‚Äôt wait to come back here again.
A true sensory journey√¢‚Ç¨‚Äùlocally sourced ingredients shine, though the tasting menu is a little pricey.

Always a great dining experience at ILIS. The space is stunning, the service is warm and seamless, and the dishes are creative and delicious. Every course felt thoughtful and exciting. The open kitchen vibe is definitely a bonus and adds to‚Ä¶

Stopped in for drinks and small bites. The interior is very clean and sleek. The drinks were amazing. The food was top tier. The open kitchen was a nice visual. The entire staff was so professional and friendly. I will definitely be back.

My husband and I just dined at Ilis for our anniversary for the first time. This is a must try restaurant that we will certainly return to. The space is chic and gorgeous, the service impeccable, drinks superb and the open kitchen full of genius chef-beyond. Each beautifully plated dish that came out was incredible. I highly recommend having a full meal or they offer a seat at their bar for drinks and a la carte. Incredible experience!

Took my husband here for his birthday, and it was a wonderful experience. The service was outstanding.  The mood in the restaurant is calm and subtle.  The food  represented a unique selection of fish, caviar, and chicken, and the sweeter dishes were simple but elegant in their confessions.  I would go there again.

What an amazing dinner! Every course was better than the next. The flavors were bold, the dishes were creative, the ambiance and staff was incredible. Would highly recommend!!

Extra kudos for the non-alcoholic drink pairing! It was so imaginative and paired perfectly with the food!

ILIS has a really interesting vibe. Walking in, it almost felt like being in a cool art gallery that also manages to feel super warm and welcoming. It's a really comfortable space, and there was a great energy in the kitchen that made it easy to relax and enjoy the evening.

The staff were fantastic. The flow of service felt so natural and everything was timed perfect. This definitely added a lot to the experience!

And omg the food and drinks? It was not your average menu. They've got some really creative and original dishes and cocktails that were unique but also nostalgic. Every dish and cocktail were so well thought out. We were truly blown away.

Overall, ILIS was a really enjoyable experience. It's a bit different from your typical restaurant, in the best way possible. If you're looking for a place in Greenpoint with a unique atmosphere, great service, and food/drinks, I'd definitely recommend checking it out. I'm already thinking about going back!

From the moment we stepped into ILIS, we were enveloped in an atmosphere that felt both innovative and warmly familiar. The open kitchen design allowed us to witness the seamless choreography of chefs preparing dishes with precision and passion. Ôøº

A special mention must go to Samantha, who took extraordinary care of us throughout the evening. Her deep knowledge of the menu and genuine enthusiasm enhanced our dining experience immensely. She guided us through the selection of ingredients from the dynamic menus, ensuring each choice resonated with our preferences.

The concept of chefs serving the dishes they prepare added a personal touch that made each course feel intimate and thoughtfully crafted. The use of seasonal North American ingredients, combined with techniques like fermentation and open-fire cooking, resulted in flavors that were both bold and nuanced. Ôøº Ôøº

The ambiance, complemented by curated artwork and natural materials, created a dining environment that was both sophisticated and inviting. ÔøºWe had a great time just hanging out there.

In summary, our evening at ILIS was nothing short of exceptional. Samantha‚Äôs attentive service and the team‚Äôs collective dedication to their craft made for a memorable culinary journey. We eagerly anticipate our next visit.

At $225pp. This high end modern dinning spot was definitely visually appealing and delicious. We selected the fluke two ways and the squid. Every single dish was very nice and the service was great. The green grass dessert was surprisingly delicious and addictive.

Where do I begin...it was not just a great food, impeccable service, an a pleasant ambiance- it was an experience, a story "told" through all the senses: sight, smell, touch, hearing and taste - everything was involved and actively participated in the process. The moment you walk in - you find yourself in another dimension: dimmed lights, high ceilings, wall art, raw brick wall, and a very peculiar aromas  greet you upon arrival.
We choose Market Menu, and enjoyed picking the ingredients. It felt like we were active participants and chef's helpers.
Every single dish - was a piece of art! Every bite awoke taste buds in ur mouth. It was one of the best experiences we were fortunate to have. You could distinguish every single ingredient in the dish: the herbs' freshness, the fish rawness, scallops sweetness. It was truly unforgettable and incomparable. Thank you to the chefs and all the team.

Really disappointing experience. Started off on a high. We chose the food tasting menu. Ambiance was nice. Open plan with the chefs preparing the food in the middle of the room. Cocktails were nice and the server was friendly and helped choose nice wine pairings for dinner. We were very excited for the food but each of the 14 courses were just one let down after another. The scallop was the highlight and maybe the potato but it wasn‚Äôt enough to make me want to ever come back. I was really looking forward to having some nice tuna but they served us the carcass of the tuna as a ceviche type course bit there was barely any tuna on it. They then took the carcass after we finished flipped it over and served it to us again with new seasoning? Not good enough. There wasn‚Äôt enough fish to even appreciate what they were trying to do. At this price point there are so many better options in the area. Maybe we just came on a bad night?
This place is a joke. Beautiful space though.
Excellent service.

Parents always said if I had nothing good to say I should keep quiet but I just can‚Äôt keep silent on this one. ILIS was such a disappointment.
Reservations may seem like they are booked out however it is just a marketing stunt to make it seem like they are busy but they really aren‚Äôt. Online they only showed availability for 6:45-7pm but when we were there, there was only one other table.
Their field guid option where the chef supposedly chooses your dishes ‚Äúsignature dishes‚Äù for you was such a let down a 3hr meal and everything was raw, except the duck which was also under cooked. I thought they had to be cooking something amazing if the food was taking this long.
One would think letting the chef choose for you ‚Äúfield guide‚Äù the chefs would bring out the best or come up with a tasting menu that‚Äôs more than over salted/seasoned raw food. Sad to say I couldn‚Äôt get out of there fast enough and go down to the corner to get a couple slices of pizza

En fantastisk oplevelse p√• Ilis!

Ilis leverer en sublim helhedsoplevelse, hvor alt g√•r op i en h√∏jere enhed. De stilfulde og stemningsfulde omgivelser skaber den perfekte ramme for en uforglemmelig aften. Baren byder p√• sp√¶ndende og velskabte drinks, mens vinkortet imponerer med et n√∏je udvalgt sortiment.

Maden er en sand oplevelse ‚Äì kreativ, velsmagende og fuld af overraskelser. Hver ret er gennemt√¶nkt og udf√∏rt til perfektion. Hertil kommer en betjening, der er i s√¶rklasse ‚Äì opm√¶rksom, im√∏dekommende og med en √¶gte passion for at give g√¶sterne den bedste oplevelse.

Ilis er uden tvivl et sted, man har lyst til at vende tilbage til. En klar anbefaling herfra!

Our first time and this this place is amazing   The award winning space alone is worth the trip to Greenpoint.    Typically food that is this creative falls flat.  Not this place everything was a feast for the eyes and delicious.  Service is impeccable!  It's a must for foodies

The food, atmosphere, service, and staff were all amazing! I went here for my birthday and they truly did make it a night to remember. We did one of the tasting menus and were not disappointed! I will definitely be back

Fantastic experience. Great food served in fun ways. The field guide menu was paced perfectly, we never felt overwhelmed. Beautiful restaurant, makes it feel special the moment you walk in. And very chill service, which I appreciate at a fancy restaurant. Worth going for a celebratory dinner. I see some comments here complaining about the the price, but they seem very fair. This is the price for such a high end experience in NYC. So save up and enjoy! P.S. Mads wearing the turtle neck under the apron is a great look. Makes him look like the Pep Guardiola of chefs.

What a disappointment. They served a raw pork chop around the bone without a warning. When we asked our lovely server/bartender if that was how they cook pork, she went ‚Äúback‚Äù and asked the ‚Äúchef.‚Äù Our bartender then informed us that that‚Äôs how they cook the pork. Now, a little pink is okay, but this was entirely raw around the bone. That also would have been fine if we had been told how they source the meat and given a heads-up that this is how they prepare the dish. We probably would have ordered raw pork anyway if it had been clearly marked on the menu. Can you imagine going to a German restaurant and mett isn‚Äôt marked as raw? Probably not.

Our bartender asked if there was anything they could do, and we said not really, since we had already eaten the food. After that, nobody checked on us, mentioned any desserts, or asked if we wanted anything else. Mind you, we were there to watch the Super Bowl, and they had advertised that there would be draft beers (there was one) and pork sammies (none). Towards the end of halftime, we asked for the check and were rather surprised to see that we weren‚Äôt even comped for a drink.

When we mentioned our surprise to our bartender, she called the ‚Äúmanager,‚Äù and oh boy‚ÄîI‚Äôve had better interactions with drunk college students in dive bars. First of all, I was there with my husband, and the dish was for two, but the manager chose to talk directly and only to me. Because I was sitting on a bar chair, his face was in my face the entire time. I was aggressively questioned about why we even ate the pork if it was raw‚Äîum, because it was served under dim bar lighting‚Äîand he was just confrontational for absolutely no reason. I asked if he was the manager since his behavior was bizarre, and he confirmed that he was. He told me the pork came from his grandfather‚Äôs farm somewhere upstate, as if I should inherently know this.

Look, I‚Äôm not against risky food. I just have this radical idea that I should personally decide what I‚Äôm eating and how much risk I‚Äôd like to take at any given moment. After going back and forth with this extremely rude guy, I finally told him that I just wanted to watch the game and that the bill was fine. He did not let it go and continued arguing with me, insisting that he was right and I was wrong. At this point, I might have pointed out that he was being unreasonably rude. We weren‚Äôt trying to avoid paying our bill, but some acknowledgment would have been nice. As soon as my husband interrupted and said what I had already repeated at least five times‚Äîthat we weren‚Äôt able to see the rawness around the bone due to the dim lighting at the bar‚Äîwe were comped almost half of the bill. We hadn‚Äôt even asked for that and had repeatedly told them not to comp us for the food.

Regardless, the food was absolutely amazing, along with the service, which I even mentioned to the manager/chef. But I personally don‚Äôt like being treated as a nuisance for pointing out a mess up on their end. We both enjoyed the food so much, and it‚Äôs really a shame that our night ended on such a bad note for absolutely no reason. Needless to say, won‚Äôt be back.

The food was good but the $2000 tab for 4 people is ridiculous.  We got the low end prix fix at $225 per person.  Decided to get 2 add on plus the $15 mark up for the lobster dish and a few drinks each and the bill ends up at 2 grand.  That is not a typo.  Two thousand dollars for dinner for four.  Good food but definitely not worth that price point.

We loved the evening. The food was surprising. Very creative, wonderful taste and texture most of the time and real interesting. We did get excellent advice on the wine. We had a truly wonderful white Chardonnay‚Äôs from Oregon. We liked that the guys making the food also served it. Friendly and efficient. Atmosphere is real nice. We felt welcome, relaxed and comfortable. This evening was made about us. People and food created a wonderful evening with a great experience. All in all very much worth it. In spite of a steep bill.
Best meal in very long time. Flavors are balanced and harmonious. The "house" moves like the tide around the dining room. Thanks Bobby for the kitchen tour and chef Mads for taking time.
Incredible experience from the ambiance to the service to the fun and thoughtful dishes. Maybe the best meal I've ever had!

Ilis was highly recommended to us by a friend who is a chef, after we asked about suggestions on restaurants in New York that truly push boundaries. It did not disappoint. While we are quite familiar with the concept of radical local sourcing and seasonal cooking organised by colder and warmer days, (yes, days not months), Ilis still managed to surprise us. We opted for the market menu, which is tailored to the ingredients available on that very day, and were treated to an additional dish. Each course was impeccably well prepared and presented effortlessly, and fun! The natural taste of the ingredients was allowed to shine, offering the rare opportunity to unspoil your palate and rediscover how herbs, vegetables, and meat/fish taste on their own, when not suffocated in fat, sugar, and spices. This, we believe, is the key to the success of Ilis and its chef Mads Refslund: being able to keep the dishes almost naked while never  loosing the culinary direction. An absolute standout was the extra dish: raw tuna scraped from the dorsal fin spine, followed by the other side grilled with sesame. It was nothing short of a feast! Another memorable feature is Ilis' book of ingredients, which you can browse through between courses. It offers insight into their sourcing, philosophy, food preferences, and quirks (giggle). Lastly, the open kitchen is from another orbit, with its wood-fired charcoal oven, open barbecues, and dedicated adjacent fish and meat smoking stations. We could rave on and on about it. Very special place, which easily deserves six stars.
One of the best experiences I‚Äôve had in NY!

V expensive so stayed in lounge area. Really cool place if you‚Äôre into the cool thing. Pretty. A bit too chic for me. The drinks were really weird (not necessarily opposed) and not so good (necessarily opposed when >$20). Fun. Good bone marrow
Ausgezeichnet

Really enjoyed our dinner here. Came for my birthday with my husband and there was a note on the table when we arrived. The vibe here is fantastic and the food was wonderful. There are two tasting options we decided to select four ingredients vs the 12 course tasting menu and it was delicious.  My husband and I had to select the same 4 , which was a discussion, but we landed in a delicious place :). My only feedback is that because the chefs are the ones to talk about each course and they rotate, there was a bit of inconsistency on the instruction / description. Everyone was wonderful but one guy made it a bit confusing

Amazing restaurant. Always innovating, beautiful decoration. I really enjoy the open kitchen, it‚Äôs like watching a show. It‚Äôs high-end but it‚Äôs fun, doesn‚Äôt feel pretentious. Definitely worth it.
Absolutely incredible. I‚Äôll remember this meal for the rest of my life.
Great
Very unique. If you're reading this, you should definitely go.
Phenomenal place, delicious food, memorable flavors, excellent service, beautiful ambiance.

Not very often a new restaurant lives up to the hype but ILIS not only lives up to it, it surpasses it. What a completely wonderful experiences, beautiful space, great vibe, fantastic staff (every single one of them was pleasant, knowledgeable, and engaging), and the food is absolutely INCREDIBLE. Pricey? I don't know, I'm a big believer in getting what you pay for so I have absolutely no problem with the price point, it was more than worth it. Cannot wait to return.
Thoroughly enjoyed the experience! The space is beautiful, the staff is knowledgeable and engaging and the food was delicious. Will be back to try more

Truly a lovely experience. The food is out there and creative, so I wasn‚Äôt expecting to like every dish, but I truly ate everything with joy. Wine matched perfectly and if there was an alcohol/food that wasn‚Äôt our jam, they switched it out when they could. Didn‚Äôt happen often, especially as I want to try everything before making a ‚Äúnot for me‚Äù decision, but they were extremely kind to do so.

Service was also stellar - each chef/server was a endless book of knowledge and loved the food they made & served.  They answered all my stupid questions and it made the food more approachable/exciting. Each ingredient was sourced with care and prepared with deep consideration to flavor & exploration. Truly incredible.

Thank you team ilis - can‚Äôt wait to enjoy again!

At the outset, we came to ILIS after looking forward for months to dine here and with expectations of a world-class dining experience and impeccable food. Unfortunately, while the food was good, it wasn‚Äôt great and didn‚Äôt live up to the $325 per person tasting menu price tag. Many dishes lacked wow factor and punch, though inventive and visually stunning. Service, on the whole, was world-class, with one exception that was quickly remedied - my wife‚Äôs scallop dish was grainy, gritty and the crunch of sand destroyed the delicate texture I enjoyed - one server explained that ‚Äúthis happens‚Äù and that there was nothing they could do about it. Our main server was aghast at the initial explanation and immediately took steps to try to make it right, while guaranteeing that the kitchen would never deem this acceptable. The space is immaculate and beautiful, airy and bright, and was totally unexpected before stepping in from the street.

We had a really nice time at Ilis, appreciated the food, ambiance, and service. We had tried to walk in during their soft opening week and didn‚Äôt realize it wasn‚Äôt totally open yet, so Will helped us with our reservation. We were so happy to see him again during our dinner.

We had the 12 course tasting menu, which was a significant amount of food, so if you‚Äôre not a big eater maybe opt for the 7 course. Very seafood forward which I absolutely loved. Everything was delicious. Wine pairings are offered, but having read great reviews about the cocktails, we skipped that. Cocktails are minimalistically presented, but flavours speak for themselves. I was rolling over full by the time dessert came around, which was slightly underwhelming, maybe a warm dessert would be a nice touch.

Some earlier reviews mentioned service issues and slow serving times. We didn‚Äôt experience any of this. Service was great and food came out efficiently, so I would not hesitate visiting if concerned about service related issues from earlier reviews!

Went for our 1 year anniversary. My boyfriend had been dreaming about trying this place since we missed out on Noma when it was still open. For me, it‚Äôs hard to beat Fyn in South Africa. If you‚Äôre looking for one of the most memorable meals of your life, go there.

The service here was ok. For $800+ it would‚Äôve been nice if the staff acted more interested and added to the experience. But they were more on the shy and quiet side albeit very nice and professional nonetheless.

The organized chaos in the kitchen was a vibe. Love that you barely noticed them but you know they‚Äôre hustling in there. The beginning plates were all very normal, nothing spectacular about the flavors.

My gazpacho straw didn‚Äôt work ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è and the grilled fish was totally meh. The sashimi side was delightful though but it was almost forgotten as we overheard someone mention it and made sure to ask our waiter if we were supposed to get it as well. By dish 6 it started getting more exciting. Really tasty and fun plates towards the end.

I read people talking about a la carte and maybe that would‚Äôve been the way to go for a lot less $. Sometimes it‚Äôs worth it, other times it‚Äôs really not.

I am giving 5 stars because the current rating is 4.3 and they deserve better especially if we are going for Michelin stars. Was it 100% perfect, no. Was it absolutely incredible? Yes. Gorgeous restaurant, inventive food, colorful staff, beautiful people watching and organized chaos. We went last Saturday and cannot stop talking about it. We did the field menu, a 3 hour experience with one of the best wine pairings I ever had. I would say top 2 after Stone Barn in terms of wine pairing. Their staff are knowledgeable and it is clear they were recruiting across the country. Next time we plan to just come and try more cocktails and eat a la cart.

Wow, what an experience! Starting from the front door, ILIS oozes beauty, style and flair. The completely open kitchen is a real treat, allowing you to see how the staff bring everything together. Sitting at the bar gives you a front row seat to this spectacle, which is where we (a party of 4) sat. For those who don‚Äôt like sitting at the bar, this bar is different. Plenty of space (deep counters) and they do a great job spacing everyone out so you don‚Äôt have to shout to be heard.

We did the Field Guide tasting menu, and 2 of us did the wine pairing (which was excellent) and one of us did the non-alcoholic beverage pairing. Instead of just zero proof cocktails, the nonalcoholic pairing was made of interesting nonalcoholic wines, which I appreciated. The food was phenomenal, inventive and beautifully plated (the bowl for one of the dishes was made entirely of ice!). My absolute favorites were the Brussels sprouts ‚Äúon the cob‚Äù and the whole fish! My only complaint about the fish is that I wish they had given each person their own fish, rather than giving one fish for every two persons. I also ordered a couple things a la carte: an oyster and a drink that was inside of a squash. The oyster was great but I could‚Äôve done without the squash drink.

The price is steep, but on par for restaurants of this nature. One person in our party said he could do with a slice of pizza after the meal, because he was still hungry. The rest of us were fine, but not stuffed. So I recommend not coming here super hungry.

Overall, I‚Äôm so glad I got a chance to try this place, and can‚Äôt wait for my next visit!

Beautiful open concept kitchen, it was kind of like watching everything unfold in front of you, would highly recommend eating at the counter so you can watch.

We got the tasting menu that was $195pp, came with ~7 courses and they‚Äôll come around with a cart as well with some snacks.

We fairly enjoyed the overall experience but some of the seafood dishes were a little too salty. Our favorites were the desserts and the pheasant.

Innovative + Sustainable + Delicious

What a journey! How can i explain the amazing experience i had at Ilis. The restaurant concept farm to table it is unique.

You really can feel the flavour of their fresh and top ingredients presented in their maximal expression. The Nordic style of cooking with a Ny twist it is one of a kind.

The menu tasting progression from vegetables to proteins play a very important part. It is like a symphony, like if you go to theater and they show you a story. You never feel heavy. We really appreciate the taste of every ingredient until we get to the main course.

The ice + fire concept it is so creative! Using nature elements that engage you the whole experience. I recently visited ILIS, a newly opened restaurant in Brooklyn. The restaurant's culinary style is Scandinavian, influenced by the renowned Noma, and features seasonal plants, seafood, and game from North America. This unique combination makes ILIS stand out among New York restaurants. Despite being located in a less convenient area of Brooklyn, the restaurant excels in food taste, dish presentation, and overall service, perfectly aligning with the Michelin three-star description of an 'exceptional cuisine that is worth a special journey.'

Several aspects of the restaurant left a deep impression:
1. The restaurant follows the farm-to-table concept but goes beyond the ordinary, reaching a 'nature-to-table' level. They source ingredients from nature, including those overlooked by many farms, providing a taste experience uncommon in regular restaurants.

2. The presentation of dishes is exceptional, utilizing seafood shells and plant-based containers as utensils, enhancing the overall taste experience.

3. The cafeteria operates smoothly, with a clear separation between cold and hot food areas, ensuring food safety and peace of mind for diners enjoying cold dishes.

4. Both servers and chefs are enthusiastic about preparing and introducing dishes. Their positive service helps customers have a comfortable dining experience, showcasing their knowledge and passion for their work.

5. The restaurant has perfect lighting with a Nordic cool-toned yet warm atmosphere. The background music complements the ambiance well, maintaining an ideal volume.

However, being a newly opened restaurant, there are areas for improvement:
1. The pace of serving dishes is slow. Opting for the Field Guide menu took a total of 3.5 hours, which might be too long for those with other evening plans. Some cold dishes had intervals of over half an hour, making the wait for the next course a bit tedious. Shortening the dining time to 2-2.5 hours could provide a more coherent taste experience and allow the restaurant to accommodate more guests in one evening.

2. The restaurant does not provide a printed menu after the meal. While chefs and servers announce the dishes, having a printed menu for guests to take as a keepsake would be a nice addition.

3. The Field Guide menu predominantly features seafood, lacking variety in meats and vegetables. Adding a couple of options like beef, venison, and poultry, along with fresh vegetables as accompaniments to seafood dishes or preparing seaweed as a vegetarian option, might enhance the taste experience.

4. The desserts are overly simple, and all are milk-based, resulting in some repetition. Introducing a solid dessert, such as cake, chocolate, or fruit, alongside the existing liquid milk-based dessert, could add variety.

In conclusion, ILIS is a highly impressive restaurant, and as a new establishment, the areas for improvement only increase the anticipation for the next dining experience.

Everything was timed perfectly and service was professional and informative without being intrusive. The food was excellent. We had the field guide menu and left full but not overly so. If we had to summarise the restaurant with a sentence, it would be ‚Äúa feast for your eyes‚Äù.

Ilis is original and elegant and takes meticulous care of every single detail of the decoration / presentation of the food, however, we feel they focus to much on the locally sourced story and perfect presentation, but the raw materials are not very tasty‚Ä¶ it felt like sleeping with a Victoria secret model, but not being able to climax!

All things said, service was fenomenal, we got great wine recommendations, and they were always very attentive.

Our favourite dish was the duck, which combined a breast confit, with a kebab meat at the end of the duck drumsticks. Very original and great flavour and texture.

We enjoyed the experience overall and we are glad that we tried the restaurant. Don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a place that we will repeat though

Went for the 7 course tasting menu in December and it was unfortunately pretty mediocre. The concepts were interesting, featuring lots of bitter/earthy elements complemented by tart/citrus notes, but execution was hit or miss.

While some courses like the scallops in the ice bowl and trout with cabbage were delightful and balanced sweetness, brine, citrus, spice, earthiness and texture, the smoked salmon was the opposite - smoky and salty notes stacked on top of each other to the point of being inedible.

While the brussel sprouts "on the cob" were presented in an interesting way and cooked well, I could not taste any material difference compared to regular brussel sprouts. It feels like I could have done something very similar at home with skewers, some seasoning, and a grill (I certainly wouldn't claim this for some of the other dishes that were served).

My $18 urchin add-on had barely any urchin in it, mostly just foam.

The cocktails and the dessert, however, were excellent and well balanced. Loved the ice cream with the finger lime. For ~$275 all in though, I expected to be blown away and unfortunately wasn't

Some courses are almost pure theater. When the sweet potato arrives, a server pours hot beeswax over it and then inverts an hourglass egg timer. This is supposed to signal when the potato is ready to eat, but the heat from a thin coat of‚Ä¶

One of the most innovative new restaurants in NYC (in Greenpoint Brooklyn to be specific) comes from Mads Refslund (Noma co-founder) and his business partner, Will Douillet of Alinea.
My dinner at ILIS was unlike any restaurant experience I've had before. The space and the vibe are SOOOO amazing and the staff is perfection. I dined solo and asked to be seated at the chef's counter which I highly recommend (even for couples). Not only was each and every person I interacted with super knowledgeable about the food, they were also kind and friendly and welcoming. Please note that I would never describe myself as a highly experimental diner but I more than enjoyed every element of the 12-course dinner.  My favorites included all the eel dishes (I'm a huge fan) plus the antelope and the duck. So while I may NOT crave any particular dish, I definitely crave the experience Mads and his team have created at ILIS - and I will be back for that extraordinary vibe and ambiance and overall experience.

Hard to capture lightning in a bottle like they did. Flawlessly executed fresh food, novel presentations, and attentive service. Yeah, it's expensive, but I've had a lot of meals at that price point that weren't half as good

anyone who hates on Ilis doesn‚Äôt enjoy food as an experience- this meal is an journey and if you come in open minded and ready for an experience, you are in a real treat. we did the 7 course option for $195, and it was a lot of food. the best courses were the main- a beautiful trout that was cooked to perfect with this amazing charcoal grilled cabbage with salmon roe. my other favorite courses were the live scallop dressed with a pomelo-like citrus and the rye porridge dessert. every course was an adventure and we definitely tried things that we wouldn‚Äôt order on a menu, and THAT is the magic of Ilis.

the service was impeccable- one of the chefs is your server, which felt a little gimmicky in the beginning, but it was actually a great experience. we loved watching the open kitchen and seeing the open flame grill.

the only misses in my opinion were the tuna (it was a bit fishy for my taste) and the timing/pace of the meal. in the beginning, the pace was super slow and we were waiting for our next course for ages. then, the pace was almost too fast. also, there are a lot of citrus elements used- so sour is a common theme of the meal, but i didn‚Äôt dislike it. I could see how some people might though.

there was also no carbs- which for a carb person, is a little tough. I wish there was a bread & butter deal with the crudite or something to ground down the entree with.

Go for the experience of having chefs wait your table. It brings an earnestness and credibility to questions and conversations around the menu. If you‚Äôre a fanboy of Chef Mads - he‚Äôs likely to be right in front of you in the central, open kitchen. Spectacular presentation and ingredient quality. Sophisticated interior. Great cocktails.

Sometimes you have dinner and other times you have an experience that transcends your culinary desires. Ilis is the latter. The food is inventive yet approachable and delicious. The ambiance and venue is absolutely gorgeous. The staff and hospitality is devoted to the craft taking place inside this kitchen. There is nothing quite like it in NYC. You will leave with full belly and a brand new restaurant recommendation to tell your friends they MUST try!

One of absolute best in the city. Menu changes like every day, but they could make your night. Interior is super cool, staffs are so nice, and the presentation of each food is amazing. It‚Äôs expensive but compared to many Michelin two and three stars place, - I believe they will get some stars soon - it‚Äôs reasonable. Highly recommended.

We were very excited to try this place being fans of Alinea and Noma, but this experience fell short of our expectations in many ways.

Service:
Everyone was pleasant and friendly, but they really need to pay more attention to detail.

We noted in our Resy reservation one of us has a scallop aversion, responded to an email asking us about dietary restrictions of said scallop aversion, then told our server about the scallop aversion when we seated after being asked again of dietary restrictions. She also did not appear to have known about the restriction beforehand, which made us feel like she did not even bother reading the note, and reassured us the scallop aversion isn‚Äôt an issue. Then guess what, I still got served scallops! One apology, and 10 minutes of waiting later, they brought over a carrot soup. This isn‚Äôt a big issue but this shouldn‚Äôt be happening at a restaurant charging close to $400 per person. Also thankfully, it wasn‚Äôt an allergy.

We also did not leave with a menu explaining the food we ate or list of wines we got to try, which is the norm for restaurants of this price point and caliber. There also were no snacks/treats to take home (also customary of restaurants in this price point) and no add ons to the menu (or we weren‚Äôt made of aware of such options). Our check was dropped on the table the moment our desserts were taken away (as in our server with the check was right behind the other server taking away our plates), which we also don‚Äôt experience often‚Ä¶ usually, the check is brought over when asked.

We also started off with ordering 2 cocktails that never came and our server completely forgot about.

Food: Honestly, it was OK. Nothing tasted bad but nothing was outrageously impressive either. The antelope was interesting and we appreciated the eel, but nothing was innovative, which we expected based on the founder being a Noma alum.

We aren‚Äôt people with big appetites but we found ourselves not stuffed to the brim, which also is not the norm for us at these kinds of restaurants. If they had not given us the bread course, we would likely be still hungry afterwards. We could imagine some people could leave hungry.

Wine pairing: phenomenal and we really appreciated the inclusion of sakes, which paired really well with the seafood-heavy menu. Highlight of our meal.

Space:
The space is gorgeous. High-end Brooklyn warehouse vibes, very different from the other similar fine dining experiences in the city (comparing mostly to Aska, also in Brooklyn and Scandinavian).

Summary: It was OK - but it was too expensive and the backgrounds of the founders are too impressive to be just OK. It should‚Äôve been phenomenal, and it COULD have been. Hope this review helps them do better because I really want this place to succeed. Our other friends have tried the cheaper menu (Market Menu) at $195 and had a better experience. You even get a fun activity of choosing your ingredients, which the Field Menu does not provide. I think we would‚Äôve left happier if we had done that, as nothing in the Field Menu made it feel like we had pay the premium for a reason. I would love to come back and try their cocktail experience, as it reminds me of Aviary, but I would skip their dining experience for now.

A meal that is a true experience of culture and cuisine. it‚Äôs rare to find an establishment that prioritizes preserving the flavor of the high quality ingredients rather than lathering it in dairy and spices.

For this price point I would expect a bit more. Here are the takeaways:
